name: High-End Smoked Turkey Sandwich
description: Premium sandwich with house-smoked turkey breast, thick-cut bacon, fresh vegetables, and gourmet spreads. Single serving yields 2 substantial sandwiches.

ingredients.name: Smoked Turkey Breast
ingredients.notes: thick-sliced, ~4 oz per sandwich, totaling ½ lb for the serving

ingredients.name: Heirloom Tomato
ingredients.notes: sliced into 4 thin slices, 2 slices per sandwich

ingredients.name: Ripe Avocado
ingredients.notes: for day-of slicing, ~½ avocado per sandwich

ingredients.name: Garlic-Herb Aioli or Spicy Honey Mustard
Microgreens
ingredients.notes: optional, arugula or radish sprouts, ½ tbsp per sandwich

instructions: Smoke Turkey (Day Before or Morning Of): Season 8 oz turkey breast with a pinch of smoked paprika, garlic powder, thyme, and black pepper. Smoke at 225°F for ~1–1.5 hours until internal temperature reaches 165°F. Cool, wrap, and refrigerate. Thick-slice (¼–½ inch) into two 4 oz portions. Store in an airtight container (fridge, 5–7 days).

Cook Bacon: Preheat oven to 400°F. Lay 6 bacon strips on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Bake 15–18 minutes until crispy. Drain on paper towels, cool, and store in an airtight container (fridge, 5–7 days).
Prep Vegetables: Wash and dry 4 lettuce leaves. Slice tomato into 4 thin slices. Store separately in an airtight container with a paper towel (fridge, 3–5 days).

Prepare Pickled Onions (Optional): Thinly slice ¼ small red onion. Combine in a small jar with 2 tbsp vinegar, 2 tbsp water, ¼ tsp sugar, and pinch of salt. Shake and refrigerate for 1 hour (lasts 2 weeks).
Store Bread: Store 4 slices of sourdough or ciabatta in a bread box or wrapped in a clean towel. If freezing, thaw slices as needed.
Toast Bread (Day-Of, Optional): Lightly toast 2 slices of bread per sandwich for texture.
Apply Spread: Spread 1–2 tsp of either garlic-herb aioli or spicy honey mustard on each slice (choose based on preference).

Layer First Sandwich: Place 2 lettuce leaves on one slice (moisture barrier). Add 4 oz thick-sliced smoked turkey. Layer 3 bacon strips. Add 2 tomato slices. Slice or mash ½ avocado, add fresh with a squeeze of lime juice (optional). Optionally add 1 tbsp pickled onions, ½ tbsp microgreens, and a pinch of flaky sea salt and pepper.
Finish First Sandwich: Top with the second slice of bread, spread-side down. Press gently.
Repeat for Second Sandwich: Follow same layering process for remaining ingredients.
Wrap for Transport: Wrap each sandwich tightly in parchment paper or foil for portability. Store in an insulated lunch bag with an ice pack if transporting.
cookNotes: Avocado: Store whole avocado in the fridge (lasts 3–5 days). Slice or mash day-of for freshness. Optionally, pre-scoop avocado halves, wrap tightly with lime juice, and refrigerate (1–2 days).
Storage: Keep components (bread, turkey, bacon, veggies) separate until assembly to prevent sogginess. Assemble morning-of for best results.
Serving: Two sandwiches provide ~½ lb total protein (8 oz turkey). Adjust bacon or turkey slightly for lighter or heavier portions if desired.
Turkey can be smoked in advance and stored for up to a week, making this an excellent meal prep option.
For best results, use a meat thermometer to ensure turkey reaches 165°F internal temperature.
